body.class: home page-template-default page page-id-77 custom-background light-theme-royal-blue suffusion-custom preset-1000px device-desktop

div.h3: Meet some of our Faculty and Staff
Click on the images below for the latest news and headlines

article.class: post-77 page type-page status-publish hentry meta-position-corners fix

div.h4:
How does adaptability in a small district work with the current education situation students and families are facing? CEO of Pennsylvania School Board Association, Nathan Mains, asked Superintendent Maria Scott-Bollman those questions.
Listen to hear how we are adapting at Forbes Road. #cardinalpride

h4.span: Students who are completing schoolwork online can disregard the instructional packets they have received in the mail. They were sent to all students as a backup plan in case students did not have Internet access or their Internet connectivity failed.
For students who are completing paper packets, options for submitting completed work will be announced soon.

p.span: Due to the mandatory shutdown of schools, Forbes Road School District will hold all of their School Board work sessions and voting meetings online for the duration of the school closure. Any member of the public who wishes to attend a meeting may do so by using the following link on any computer:

span.span: The next work session will be on Tuesday, March 31
at 7:00 p.m. and the next voting session will be on Monday, April 6

at 7:00 p.m. Tax payers and residents of the district who wish to make comment will have the ability to do so during the public comment portion of the agenda. According to standard School Board practice, this portion of the meeting is not designed for questions and answers; it is a time for Board Members to only listen to public comment. Public microphones will be muted during other portions of the meeting to reduce background sound/feedback.

p.a: Forbes Road School District Comprehensive Plan
